patterns: Tell me about DIU Life Insurance and its offerings.
What should I know about life insurance claim procedures?
What sets DIU Life Insurance apart from other providers?
Can you provide information on the different life insurance plans offered by DIU Life Insurance?
How can I get a quote for life insurance from DIU Life Insurance?
Are there any special features or riders available with DIU Life Insurance policies?
What is the process for applying for life insurance through DIU Life Insurance?
How does DIU Life Insurance handle underwriting and approvals?
What can you tell me about DIU Life Insurance's claims and settlement process?
Is there any specific information I should be aware of regarding DIU Life Insurance?
Why might DIU Life Insurance be a good choice for life insurance coverage?
responses:
Life Insurance Benefits:
1. Normal Death of insured students: 100% of Sum Assured
2. Accidental Death: 200% of Sum Assured (Provided Death Occurs within 90 days of accidents)
3. Permanent Total Disability (Both eyes, both hands above the wrist, both feet above the ankle, one hand above the wrist, one foot above the ankle): 100% of Sum Assured (At Permanent Total Disability, individual group coverage insurance will be ceased)
How to register for student life insurance:
Registration for student life insurance is processed at the time of admission at the admission and counseling section.
How to claim insurance money for Normal Death:
1. Copy of student ID card
2. Copy of SSC certificate/NID card/Passport
3. Death certificate from a registered MBBS doctor
4. Death certificate from City Corporation/UP chairman
Additional Documents for Accidental Death:
1. Post Mortem report
2. FIR report will be required along with the death certificate
Permanent Total Disability benefit:
1. Doctor's certificate regarding disability along with X-ray report with film
2. Discharge certificate from the Hospital (when applicable)
Total Disability of student. Initial sum at risk up to BDT 2,50,000/-. Total Disability of guardian. Initial sum at risk up to BDT 3,00,000/-. For more details, visit this link: https://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/article/life-insurance

What is required for admission to Agricultural Science?
What is the minimum GPA for Daffodil International University?
responses:
Admission eligibility criteria are as follows:

General Students:
Students should have a minimum GPA of 2.5 in both Secondary School Certificate (SSC) and Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) 12th class passed, with a focus on Science and minimum grades in Physics, Mathematics, and English.

For Diploma Holders:
Students should have a minimum GPA of 2.5 in SSC and a Diploma in Computer Technology for admission.

English Medium Students:
Students should have completed five O-level subjects and at least two A-level subjects. Out of these seven subjects, applicants must have a minimum of 4 'B' grades and 3 'C' grades. Physics and Mathematics are mandatory subjects at both O-level and A-level.

General Students:

English Medium Students:
Students should have completed five O-level subjects and at least two A-level subjects. Out of these seven subjects, applicants must have a minimum of 4 'B' grades and 3 'C' grades. Physics and Mathematics are mandatory subjects at both O-level and A-level.

patterns: What are the pharmacy eligibility criteria for B.Pharmacy admission?
Tell me about the admission requirements for Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharmacy).
B.Pharmacy pharmacy admission criteria?
pharmacy admission eligibility
responses:
Admission eligibility criteria are as follows:

General Student:
Students must have a total GPA of 8.00 (on a scale of 10.00) in both Secondary School Certificate (SSC) and Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) or the 12th class equivalent from the Science group. However, GPAs less than 3.50 (on a scale of 5.00) in SSC/HSC/Equivalent are not accepted. Students must have a minimum GPA of 4.00 (on a scale of 5.00) or an 'A' grade in Chemistry, Biology, and Physics in SSC/HSC/Equivalent. In HSC/Equivalent level (except 'A' level), students must have a minimum GPA of 3.50 (on a scale of 5.00) in Mathematics. Students completing five O-level subjects and at least four A-level subjects may apply. In 'A' level, a minimum 'B' grade in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology is required, along with a minimum 'C' grade in Mathematics. Applicants must complete their admission after passing HSC/Equivalent level within the same year or the next year. Students having below a 'B' grade in English in HSC/Equivalent level must enroll in an English Language Remedial Course immediately after admission. Failures or students without Mathematics can be admitted but they have to complete an additional Mathematics course (03 credits) related to the B.Pharm curriculum.
